TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit Color extends System.ValueType implements class System.IFormattable

Docs.summary: Describes a color in terms of alpha, red, green, and blue channels.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This struct represents the .NET projection of the Windows Runtime (WinRT) `Color` struct. For more information, see [Color](https://docs.microsoft.com/uwp/api/windows.ui.color) in the UWP API reference.

MemberSignature.Value: public byte A { get; set; }
.property instance unsigned int8 A
Public Property A As Byte
public: property System::Byte A { System::Byte get(); void set(System::Byte value); };
member this.A : byte with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the sRGB alpha channel value of the color.
Docs.value: The sRGB alpha channel value of the color, as a value between 0 and 255.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This struct represents the .NET projection of the Windows Runtime (WinRT) `Color` struct. For more information, see [Color](https://docs.microsoft.com/uwp/api/windows.ui.color) in the UWP API reference.
The color of each pixel is represented as a 32-bit number: 8 bits each for alpha, red, green, and blue (ARGB). The alpha component specifies the transparency of the color: 0 is fully transparent, and 255 is fully opaque. Likewise, an **A** value of 255 represents an opaque color. An **A** value from 1 through 254 represents a semitransparent color. The color becomes more opaque as **A** approaches 255.

MemberSignature.Value: public byte B { get; set; }
.property instance unsigned int8 B
Public Property B As Byte
public: property System::Byte B { System::Byte get(); void set(System::Byte value); };
member this.B : byte with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the sRGB blue channel value of the color.
Docs.value: The sRGB blue channel value, as a value between 0 and 255.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This struct represents the .NET projection of the Windows Runtime (WinRT) `Color` struct. For more information, see [Color](https://docs.microsoft.com/uwp/api/windows.ui.color) in the UWP API reference.
The color of each pixel is represented as a 32-bit number: 8 bits each for alpha, red, green, and blue (ARGB). Each of the four components is a number from 0 through 255, with 0 representing no intensity and 255 representing full intensity. Likewise, **B** is a value from 0 to 255 with 0 representing no blue and 255 representing fully blue.

## Remarks This struct represents the .NET projection of the Windows Runtime (WinRT) `Color` struct. For more information, see [Color](https://docs.microsoft.com/uwp/api/windows.ui.color) in the UWP API reference.
For more information about this member, see <xref:System.Drawing.Color.Equals%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> in the .NET Framework API reference.
